awd_abstract_narration: Gene S. Fowler                                     DUE 9552395  Pomona College                                     FY1995 $ 56,416  Claremont, CA  91711                               ILI - Instrumentation                                                      Project:                                                      Life Sciences    Title: Neuroscience Laboratory Courses Developed    A new interdisciplinary program and major in Neuroscience was  inaugurated in 1994, which is a collaborative effort between the  Departments of Biology, Psychology and Anthropology.  The program  is a rigorous approach to the study of the functions and mechanisms  of the nervous system and related organ systems, and rests on a  foundation of lower-division laboratory courses in Biology,  Psychology, and Chemistry, plus 2 introductory core courses in  Neuroscience.  Upper division classes are specialized lab classes  in the participating disciplines.  The equipment pupchased is  allowing for the development of modern, investigative laboratory  courses in molecular and cellular neurobiology, and in behavioral  and comparative endocrinology.  Students are conducting lab  exercises in electrophysiology and neuroanatomy, the properties of  hormone receptors, and of the role of the endocrine system in  regulating metabolism.
